IMFSphereOnExpansion
[MFImplicitMF]

Collaboration diagram for IMFSphereOnExpansion:


Classes

class  IMFSphereOnExpansion
 A manifold which is the intersection of a ball about a point and an expansion about the same point. This manifold is used as a manifold of initial conditions for computing stable and unstable manifolds of hyperbolic fixed points. More...

Functions

MFImplicitMF IMFCreateSphereOnExpansion (IMFExpansion E, IMFFlow F, MFKVector p0, double eps, double R, double r, MFErrorHandler e)
 Creates a manifold which is the intersection of a sphere and the surface defined by an expansion.

Function Documentation

MFImplicitMF IMFCreateSphereOnExpansion (  IMFExpansion  E,
IMFFlow  F,
MFKVector  p0,
double  eps,
double  R,
double  r,
MFErrorHandler  e
) 
 

Creates a manifold which is the intersection of a sphere and the surface defined by an expansion.

Parameters:
E The expansion.
F The flow.
p0 The parameters for the flow.
eps The tolerance allowed for the error on the conditions that the manifold lie on the expansion.
R The raidus of the sphere.
r The default scale associated with the new manifold (MFIMFSetR).
e A place to return errors.
Returns:
A new MFImplicitMF.
